page.title: 15Language
page.content: The local{Norfolk}accent is becoming a rarity to hear these days due to the influence of the{overspill}communities from London to Thetford and also the fact that the{Armed Forces}are based in the surrounding areas.A lack of {communication}during the first half of this century retained a distinctive {accent}among the local population which is largely becoming less distinct than it might have been a few years ago. The traditional{Suffolk Swedes}and {Norfolk Dumplings}are not heard of any more. The familiar cry of"are yew origh, Bor" and "Fare ye well togither"are obsolete,except among the very old,and as they die so will the {local dialect.
